title: Futura Inline
content:
Hi  
I need assistance for purchasing a good version of Futura Inline - can't seem to find one.  
Any suggestions greatly appreciated. Thank you.
author: Stark Adriane

comments.content: As far as I know, a Futura Inline doesn't exist. [Here are some alternatives.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/inline_sans/)

Thanks for looking. There used to be a true Futura Inline

See link below:  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?LXU](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/www.identifont.com/show?LXU "http://www.identifont.com/show?LXU")

But when I click through there s no way to order it.

Any ideas?

Nice reference. Check out [Futura Serie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090204000.html). It has [SC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_caps) and [OSF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_style_figures).

Christopher - Adriane’s looking for an inline version. Serie's not going to cut it.

Adriane - I have a feeling CastleType’s Futura went off the market due to trademark restrictions. I'll find out from Jason Castle.

Thanks, Adriane, for the links leading to [Castle Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/www.castletype.com/home.html)!

Also, does anyone else find it odd that Carisma Inline is all-caps, but the rest of the Carisma family is upper and lower case?
I don’t find the inline being caps odd—it’s the sort of type that I think designers would want to use primarily in all-caps settings.
Good point, Mr. Puckett. I just noticed that Topaz is all-caps, too. Thanks.
There is also [Neutraface No. 2 Display Inline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043409/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutrafaceno2). All caps only.

Futura Inline - funny name, mh?  
I just know it as Futura licht.
